titleStmt.title: Jacob Brazell et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9190

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his excently MBeriah Magoffin Governor of Kentucky.,

Your petitioners would respectfully state as we understand there is a petition in circulation and will be shortly presented to you, asking executive clemency in the case of the Commonwealth against T. J. Strow for malissously stabing -- Nathaniel McManus, that a fare trial has been haldd before a Jury of Marshall County and that they rendered a virdict against said Strow of Five Hundred dollars fine, with six months imprisinment in the county Jail, we therefore pray that Justice may be done and such visious and immoral conduct may be Justly reproved that you will not grant their petition, and that you will not interfere in the premises,

Silas Kinney
